text: Hey all. We here at Bluleadz realized an undocumented “Feature” of Custom Modules.
if you use widget.label as a text field in your custom module it will rename the module in the edit view of your page .
nice little naming collision.
also you can reset the default content in coded templates on a per module instance using the slug of the module field as an attribute on the module tag.
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F8MQ38LQJ/screen_shot_2018-01-03_at_4.34.41_pm.png|Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 4.34.41 PM.png>

<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F8NRWCJAK/screen_shot_2018-01-03_at_4.37.12_pm.png|Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 4.37.12 PM.png>
Just thought I might share this interesting “Feature”
Not sure if i am teh last person to realize this but I thought I’d share

<@U38EZFVFE> That's pretty cool!  This seems very close to a feature I've been hoping for for use in a flexible columns.  Trying to get it to work in that application, but I seem to be hitting a wall.
This is exactly what you can use to help that.
I'm having a bit of trouble replicating what you've done.  Mind having a look at my code?
well i may be over zelous with that but it might
shoot
make sure one of your module fields has the word label in it.
text field with title Label so it is used as {{ widget.label }}

click save and refresh the edit view
